page.title: 03Hospitals in Droitwich
page.content: Droitwich has two small N.H.S. hospitals.St. John's is primarily a geriatric hospital while Highfield specialises in the treatment of rheumatic and arthritic diseases.Brine hydrotherapy has been used in Droitwich since the early 19th century and there is a small treatment pool at Highfield. 1985 has seen the opening of a new thirty-six bed,private hospital,the Worcestershire Clinic,in the town.This hospital is equipped for general surgery.It also features a brine pool,the brine being pumped from a lake 60 metres below the surface.The general public may use the pool,the charge for each session being Â£7 per person.
